title: 2 Easy Ways to Delete Cookies Using the Safari Web Browser

steps.title: Click the Safari menu.
steps.content: Click the Safari menu. This is in the top toolbar, next to the Apple icon, when Safari is open. [1] X Research source You can clear your cookies and cache without deleting your entire history .

steps.title: Click Settings….
steps.content: Click Settings… . You can find this in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Privacy.
steps.content: Click Privacy . This is the tab at the top.

steps.title: Click Manage Website Data.
steps.content: Click Manage Website Data . A new page will open.

steps.title: Select the websites you want to clear.
steps.content: Select the websites you want to clear. To select one website, click it. To select multiple websites, press and hold the Command key, and then click them. If you're unsure which websites you want to clear, you can check your history .

steps.title: Click Remove.
steps.content: Click Remove . If you selected more than one website, you'll need to click Remove All . Your cookies will be deleted for these websites.

steps.title: Block cookies (optional).
steps.content: Block cookies (optional). If you want to prevent all cookies going forward, check the "Block all cookies" box in the "Cookies and website data" section of the Preferences menu. This will stop Safari from storing cookies from websites. You may be prompted to confirm this action. Keep in mind that some websites require cookies in order to load some features. Blocking all cookies will prevent some websites from working correctly.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This looks like a grey cog icon.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Safari.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Safari . You'll find this option about halfway way down the page.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Advanced.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Advanced . This is at the very bottom of the page.

steps.title: Tap Website Data.
steps.content: Tap Website Data . You can find this at the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap Remove All Website Data.
steps.content: Tap Remove All Website Data . This is at the bottom of the page. Your cookies and cache will be deleted. [2] X Research source If you want to delete your history along with your cookies and cache, return to the Safari settings page . Scroll down and tap Clear History and Website Data , select a timeframe, and then tap Clear History .

steps.title: Block cookies (optional).
steps.content: Block cookies (optional). If you want to block cookies in the future, do the following: Navigate to the Safari settings. Tap Advanced at the bottom of the page. Toggle on Block All Cookies . Keep in mind that some websites require cookies in order to load some features. Blocking all cookies will prevent some websites from working correctly. You can also block and unblock certain websites.
